result.execSummary:
The defendant Roger Vang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
59 days sentence credit if revoked from probation.
Concurrent with: with 22CF910

Complete AODA assessment and follow-through with recommendations per Drug Court requirements; if not accepted complete within 6 months.

Comply with any programming/treatment/counseling per agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roger Vang

records.addlTxt: Time to Pay Summary returned
Time to Pay Summary mailed to Defendant

(Cases called at 11:00 AM - 22CF543, 22CF910, 22CF952)
Defendant Roger Vang appears in custody with Attorney Melissa Petersen.  Attorney Matthew Kirkpatrick appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing- waiver accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of the maximum possible penalties of the offenses to which he will plead.  Basis for repeater enhancer acknowledged.  Defendant pleads No Contest to 22CF543 Count 1: Possession of Methamphetamine; 22CF910 Count 1: Felony Bail Jumping (Repeater); and 22CF952 Count 3: Criminal Trespass (WITHOUT Repeater) and Count 4: Criminal Damage to Property (WITHOUT Repeater).  Plea Questionnaire acknowledged.  Court accepts pleas and finds the Defendant guilty.  All remaining charges are dismissed and read-in.  
As to 22CF910 and 22CF543- Court withholds sentence and orders 3 years probation with the following conditions: 
180 days in jail, with Huber or EM as determined eligible by the jail, on 22CF543, stayed pending further order of the court.
Successfully complete treatment court program.  Complete AODA assessment and follow-through with recommendations per Drug Court requirements; if not accepted complete within 6 months.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any bars, taverns, or liquor stores.  Defendant not to consume/possess an illegal drug or drug paraphernalia.  No contact with X.V., V.V., or their residences.  Comply with any programming/treatment/counseling per agent.  Court costs, DNA sample and surcharge. 
As to Counts 3 and 4 in 22CF952 - court costs, DNA sample and surcharge.

Cases called at 9:31 AM: 22CF543, 22CF910, 22CF952.
Defendant Roger Vang in custody and in court with Attorney Melissa M. Petersen.  Prosecuting Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives his right to Preliminary Hearings.
Branch 2 to schedule ARGN.
Arraignment on October 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.
